comments: API url for the source record in PlutoF referring to either material sample, specimen or living culture.
Same as bcdm:museumid and might match the bcdm:specimenid.
Not relevant since we are using source_name anyway. Multiple field id values possible in UNITE.
Same as bcdm:sampleid in case source material is held in a collection.
Same as bcdm:process_id. It is mapped to dwc:occurrenceID which says that it does not need to be specimen but can be any type of occurrence (tbc).
Each sequence belongs six different species hypotheses (SH); by default we use SH code at the 1.5% gap (distance) between sister species.
Is it the same as identification_rank below?
Should it be the same as DwC field "specificEpithet"? Otherwise, it's a duplicate of "taxon_name" field
Same as bcdm:taxon_name.
Same as bcdm:taxon_rank.
We also have other options such as "worker", "soldier", and "gynandromorph"
List of elements: adult, larva/nymph, pupa, egg.
Public source record pages should be created on UNITE homepage.
object type: specimen
object type: taxonnode
Is part of unite:samplingevent_timespan_begin and unite:samplingevent_timespan_end
We only keep track of Alpha-3 ISO codes
We use coordinateUncertaintyInMeters instead. Why not to rename this field to coord_precision just to be in accordance with the DwC label?
Maybe to follow standard here and use separate fields for broad scale (biome) and local scale environmental context (as in GBIF and ENA)?
Could be probably calculated on the fly if needed.
In our case, it could also be UNITE accession number (or both - UNITE and INSD code).

Check GBIF DNA derived data extension - https://rs.gbif.org/extension/gbif/1.0/dna_derived_data_2021-07-05.xml#target_gene and https://rs.gbif.org/extension/gbif/1.0/dna_derived_data_2021-07-05.xml#target_subfragment. See also https://docs.gbif.org/publishing-dna-derived-data/en/.
Check GBIF DNA derived data extension https://rs.gbif.org/extension/gbif/1.0/dna_derived_data_2021-07-05.xml#pcr_primers
Check GBIF DNA derived data extension https://rs.gbif.org/extension/gbif/1.0/dna_derived_data_2021-07-05.xml#pcr_primers
Maybe split this field into two separate fields - "institution sequences" (run site) and "source database"?
